sentence.text: There is growing evidence shown that microRNAs (protein polyubiquitinationNAs) are associated with cancer and can play a role in human cancers as oncogenes or tumor suppressor genes.

MicroRNA-214 (protein polyubiquitination-214) shows carcinogenesis in various tumor types, but little is known about biological functions of protein polyubiquitination-214 in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC).
In addition, the expression of protein polyubiquitination-214 inhibited proliferation of ESCC cells in vitro and inhibit the growth of xenograft tumor in vivo.
The results show protein polyubiquitination-214 serve as a tumor promoter regulating cells migration, invasion and apoptosis in ESCC.

In summary, these results suggest that protein polyubiquitination-214 serves as tumor promoter to promote proliferation, migration, invasion and inhibit apoptosis of ESCC cells by targeting negative regulation of macroautophagy via PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway.
